page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY-PLACENAMES
page.content: Many of us live in {EYNSFORD} - many people believe Aegen was a Saxon chief. The village which grew up around the local ford is named Aegansford - {EYNSFORD}. {FARNINGHAM}- Ham shows that Anglo Saxons settled there. "Ham" was the Saxon word for "home" - "ING" means son of. {DARENT} - It was called Deruentio by the ancient Britons, it means"oak river" because its valley was covered by oak trees. {SPAREPENNY LANE} - carters used this lane to avoid paying tolls on the main road. {BEESFIELD LANE}, leading to Beesfield farm, is named after the cows (beasts) which graze in fields, not after bees as one might think. It used to be known as beast field lane.
